modules.description: Computes SHA1 hashes of strings and returns their hexadecimal representations. Operates on raw string inputs and produces fixed-length hex strings. Used for generating unique identifiers from text inputs.

Computes and manipulates Software Heritage identifiers (swhid) by parsing, validating, and generating them from object data. It handles structured data including revision, directory, and content objects, along with their cryptographic hashes. Used to ensure consistent identifier generation for archival objects during ingestion or retrieval processes.

Computes SHA1 hashes from string inputs, converting them into fixed-length hexadecimal strings for unique identification. It handles raw text and outputs standardized hash values. Operations include hashing and string transformation. Examples include generating unique keys from user input or verifying data integrity through hash comparison.
